amprolium: (a) Approvals. Type A medicated articles. 25 percent to No. 016592 in § 510.600(c) of this chapter for use as in paragraph (d) of this section
(b) Special considerations. Do not use in Type B or Type C medicated feeds containing bentonite.
(c) Related tolerances. See § 556.50 of this chapter.
(d) Conditions of use—(1) Cattle. It is used as follows.
(i) 113.5 to 11350; to provide 5 milligrams per kilogram of body weight per day
Indications for use. As an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii

Limitations. Top-dress on or mix in the daily ration. Feed for 21 days when experience indicates that coccidiosis is likely to be a hazard as the sole source of amprolium. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter. A withdrawal period has not been established for this product in preruminating calves. Do not use in calves to be processed for veal
(ii) 113.5 to 11350; to provide 10 milligrams per kilogram of body weight per day
Indications for use. Calves. As an aid in the treatment of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii

Limitations. Top-dress on or mix in the daily ration. Feed for 5 days as the sole source of amprolium. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter. A withdrawal period has not been established for this product in preruminating calves. Do not use in calves to be processed for veal

(ii) 113.5 to 11350; to provide 10 milligrams per kilogram of body weight per day
Indications for use. Calves. As an aid in the treatment of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zuernii

Limitations. Top-dress on or mix in the daily ration. Feed for 5 days as the sole source of amprolium. Withdraw 24 hours before slaughter. A withdrawal period has not been established for this product in preruminating calves. Do not use in calves to be processed for veal
